column4: hello, I have some problems setting up a static ip with /etc/network/interfaces
sure, can you pastebin your /etc/network/interfaces file please?
also, note that you can "man interfaces", and "zless /usr/share/doc/ifupdown/examples/network-interfaces.gz" for some guidance.
actually i am about 100% sure that this configuration should work as it has done in prev. versions.
it's not for internet access or anything... the thing is: the interface doesn't come up correctly with it's static ip on boot
if I do sudo ifdown etho && sudo ifup eth0 it works
but i have to do it after every boot
that shouldn't be the case, with the "auto" stanza
i guess it would work with network-manager, but my wlan driver conflicts with nm, therefore i had to uninstall it...
it should work as you have specified.
that's what bothers me too... maybe I could force a ifdown and ifup on every boot? in some file...
ok thanks for your help anyways...
